page.title: 09Industry in Strathmiglo
page.content: During the 1950's and 1960's nylon and polyester became popular.The machinery used to make linen couldn't weave nylon so the industry fell away and finally closed down.In 1964 the Irvine Thread Co. took over the premises and kept some of the work-force to make cotton threads.About 5 years ago the firm became commission embroiderers, designing and embroidering badges for clubs(golf,cricket,bowling,etc.)and other organisations eg.The Bank Of Scotland(A friend for life).The biggest order the firm has ever had was for 160,000 items.A new order has just been placed,which will not be finished until next March (March,1986) for more than 200,000 items.At present the firm employs 14 people,2 men and 12 women.
